Submodules¶

AcousticZ.Room module¶

class AcousticZ.Room.Room(filepath: str, numberOfRays: int, FVect: ndarray[int], absorptionCoefficients, scatteringCoefficients)¶

Bases: object

This is the main class for the RIR simulation

All simulation parameters, physical characteristics and functionalities, that are needed to generate a RIR for a given room is stored inside this class.

RandSampleSphere(N)¶

RandSampleSphere Generate a number of random 3D directions that point in all directions (spherical shape)

This function is needed to initialize the rays first direction. It does does that by generating a specified number of random directions.

Parameters¶

Nint

number of Rays/Directions

Returns¶

np.ndarray[float]

Nx3 array with all the directions

applyRIR()¶
createReceiver(receiver=array([5., 2., 1.3]), radiusOfReceiverSphere=1.0)¶

createReceiver Create the receiver sphere

function that creates the receiver sphere at which the energy of all the rays gets evaluated.

Parameters¶

receivernp.ndarray, optional

Coordinates of the center of the receiver sphere, by default np.array( [5, 2, 1.3])

radiusOfReceiverSpherefloat, optional

radius of the receiver Sphere, by default 1.0

Raises¶

ValueError

If a center point is specified that is not inside the mesh

createSource(source=array([2, 2, 2]), radius=1.0)¶

getRoomVolume()¶
isPointInsideMesh(point: ndarray[float])¶

isPointInsideMesh check if a 3D point is inside the room

This function checks if a point is inside the room geometry

Parameters¶

pointnp.ndarray[float]

The point that gets checked

Returns¶

bool

boolean value

performRayTracing_vectorized()¶
performs main ray tracing algorithm and builds the histogram for the

collected ray energies

Raises:

ValueError: If the angle between face normal and reflected ray is greater than 90 degrees
